quoteLast: when the Arabs made their first rush, and it was just ten minutes past three when the enemy was finally repelled and the bugle sounded "Cease firing."  Yet into these pregnant eighteen minutes all that we have described, and a vast deal more, was crowded.
title: Blue Lights: Hot Work in the Soudan
author: Ballantyne, R. M. (Robert Michael), 1825-1894

quoteFirst: "Then if that telephone came at thirteen minutes before three you must have left not earlier than
quoteLast: , and the accident took place at 3:12, you ran the distance--it is actually thirteen miles and a half--in twenty minutes; that is, at the rate of forty miles an hour."
title: Manslaughter
author: Miller, Alice Duer, 1874-1942; Gruger, Frederic Rodrigo, 1871-1953 [Illustrator]

quoteLast: --oh, I know the time to-day without mistake--the door opened, and in came Mrs. Macfarlane; and do you know what she did?”
title: Afterwards, and Other Stories
author: Maclaren, Ian, 1850-1907
